excerpt: Cobblestone streets wind past open-air caipirinha bars, Afro-Bahian souvenir stores, and squares filled with musicians and dancers in historic Pelourinho. Colonial landmarks include Igreja e Convento de São Francisco and Catedral Basílica de Salvador, with their Portuguese tiles and intricate, gold-plated carvings. The Casa do Carnaval shows multimedia exhibits and costumed mannequins from the iconic street party.
detail_description: Pelourinho is a historic district in Salvador, Brazil, known for its cobblestone streets, vibrant squares with musicians and dancers, and colonial landmarks. The area features architectural gems like the Igreja e Convento de São Francisco and Catedral Basílica de Salvador, showcasing Portuguese tiles and intricate carvings. Pelourinho's Casa do Carnaval offers multimedia exhibits on the iconic street party.
name: Pelourinho
address: Salvador - State of Bahia, 40301-110, Brazil

excerpt: Historic art deco elevator with scenic views, connecting the upper & lower parts of Salvador.
detail_description: The Elevador Lacerda is a historic art deco elevator that provides scenic views while connecting the upper and lower parts of Salvador. It offers a convenient and affordable way to explore the old city center, with taxis, buses, and foot travel also being viable options. This iconic elevator was erected in the mid to late 1800s and showcases impressive Art Deco design from additional work done in the early 20th century.
name: Elevador Lacerda
address: Praça Tomé de Souza, S/N - Centro, Salvador - BA, 40020-000, Brazil

excerpt: Popular market featuring 250+ shops selling a variety of arts, crafts & souvenirs, plus restaurants.
detail_description: Mercado Modelo is a popular market in Salvador, featuring over 250 shops offering a variety of arts, crafts, and souvenirs. The large yellow building housing the market is an example of neoclassical architecture and inside, elegant stone arches crown the alleys and streets. Visitors can also enjoy a view of the Bay of All Saints from a huge curved balcony covered in umbrellas.
name: Mercado Modelo
address: Pr. Visc. de Cayru, s/n - Comércio, Salvador - BA, 40015-170, Brazil

excerpt: Known for its hip, eclectic vibe, Rio Vermelho gets lively at dusk when the bars and live music spots near Largo de Santana fill up. Several unassuming but iconic food stalls sell black-eyed pea fritters, or acarajé, a local favorite. Beaches include Praia do Buracão, popular with an LGBT crowd. In the former home of writers Jorge Amado and Zélia Gattai, Casa do Rio Vermelho has exhibits on their lives and work.
detail_description: Rio Vermelho is a vibrant and eclectic neighborhood that comes alive in the evening with its lively bars and live music venues near Largo de Santana. It's known for its iconic food stalls selling local favorite acarajé, and the popular Praia do Buracão beach, which attracts an LGBT crowd. Casa do Rio Vermelho, the former home of writers Jorge Amado and Zélia Gattai, offers exhibits on their lives and work.
name: Rio Vermelho
address: Salvador - State of Bahia, Brazil

excerpt: Popular beach with a nearby lighthouse is a lively destination for swimming & sun seekers.
detail_description: Farol da Barra Beach is a lively destination popular for swimming and sunbathing. It is home to the St. Anthony Fort and the historic Farol da Barra lighthouse, where Amerigo Vespucci arrived in 1501. The beach offers stunning views of All Saints Bay and the city, with amenities such as eateries, beach umbrellas, and loungers for rent.
name: Farol da Barra
address: Barra, Salvador - State of Bahia, Brazil

excerpt: 18th-century Catholic church with elaborate exterior carvings & ornate interior.
detail_description: The Church and Convent of San Francisco, also known as the Golden Church, is an 18th-century Catholic church located in Salvador. Its exterior features intricate carvings, while the interior is covered in pure gold leaf, making it a stunning example of Portuguese Baroque architecture in the Americas. Legend has it that builders used a thousand kilos of gold powder for its construction.
name: Church and Convent of San Francisco
address: Largo do Cruzeiro de São Francisco, S/N - Pelourinho, Salvador - BA, 40020-280, Brazil

excerpt: This Mannerist-style cathedral built in the 17th century features baroque altars & paintings.
detail_description: The Cathedral of Salvador, also known as the Cathedral Basilica of Salvador, is a stunning Mannerist-style cathedral built in the 17th century. Situated on the Terreiro de Jesus next to Praca da Se, it was originally part of a Jesuit monastic and educational complex. The facade is adorned with stone brought from Portugal, while the interior boasts beautiful Baroque decorations dating back to the 18th century.
name: Cathedral of Salvador
address: Largo Terreiro de Jesus, s/n - CEP:, Salvador - BA, 40026-010, Brazil

excerpt: Gallery featuring wood statues, textiles & other artifacts related to African-Brazilian culture.
detail_description: The Cultural Afro Brazilian Museum, located in Salvador, Bahia, Brazil, is a significant institution dedicated to showcasing the rich African-Brazilian culture and history. The museum boasts an impressive collection of traditional Brazilian handicrafts and historical artifacts such as wood carvings, hand-woven baskets, pottery, ceramics, and 27 enormous carved wooden panels by renowned artist Hector Julio Paride Bernabo.
name: Cultural Afro Brazilian Museum
address: R. das Vassouras, 25 - Centro Histórico, Salvador - BA, 40020-056, Brazil

excerpt: Waterside building housing a leading collection of international contemporary art.
detail_description: MAM - Museu de Arte Moderna da Bahia is a leading contemporary art space located in a picturesque waterside building, the Solar do Unhao. It showcases an impressive collection of international modern art and hosts exhibitions by established artists from Brazil and abroad. The museum features five exhibition rooms, an outdoor sculpture garden (Parque das Esculturas), and a movie theater, making it a vibrant cultural hub for artistic events of different languages.
name: MAM - Museu de Arte Moderna da Bahia
address: Av. Lafayete Coutinho, s/n - Comércio, Salvador - BA, 40301-155, Brazil

excerpt: Salvador, the capital of Brazil’s northeastern state of Bahia, is known for its Portuguese colonial architecture, Afro-Brazilian culture and a tropical coastline. The Pelourinho neighborhood is its historic heart, with cobblestone alleys opening onto large squares, colorful buildings and baroque churches such as São Francisco, featuring gilt woodwork.
detail_description: Salvador, the capital of Bahia in northeastern Brazil, is a vibrant city renowned for its Portuguese colonial architecture and rich Afro-Brazilian culture. The historic Pelourinho neighborhood is the heart of the city, with its charming cobblestone streets, colorful buildings, and stunning baroque churches like São Francisco. This cultural epicenter is filled with hilly streets lined with centuries-old structures and lively capoeira performances that bring an electric atmosphere to the area.
name: Salvador
address: State of Bahia, Brazil

excerpt: Center dedicated to famed Brazilian writer Jorge Armado, with an artsy cafe, exhibits & a bookstore.
detail_description: The Foundation Casa de Jorge Amado, established in 1987, is dedicated to preserving and studying the work of renowned Brazilian novelist Jorge Amado. Located in a historic colonial property at Largo do Pelourinho, it features a permanent exhibition showcasing the author's collection, including numerous editions of his novels translated into 49 languages. The foundation also houses an extensive array of photographs, videos, posters, and objects related to Amado's life and work.
name: Foundation Casa de Jorge Amado
address: Largo do Pelourinho, 49 - 51 - Pelourinho, Salvador - BA, 40026-290, Brazil

excerpt: Known for its sunset views, this former sugar mill offers a restaurant & modern art exhibits.
detail_description: The House and Chapel of the Former Quinta do Unhão, located in Salvador, is a historic site with a rich past. Originally a sugar mill, it has been transformed into a modern art museum and restaurant. The property includes an 18th-century manor house that once served as factories and warehouses before being refurbished by the Bahian state government. Visitors can enjoy fantastic bay views from the Museum of Modern Art, which is housed within the estate.
name: House and Chapel of the Former Quinta do Unhão
address: Av. Lafayete Coutinho - Comércio, Salvador - BA, 40015-250, Brazil

excerpt: This scenic bayside beach with calm water is a busy destination for swimming & sunbathing.
detail_description: Porto da Barra Beach is a picturesque gem nestled in Salvador, known for its tranquil waters that beckon both swimmers and sunbathers alike. This vibrant beach not only offers a perfect spot to soak up the sun but also serves as a historical landmark, being the site of Bahia's original European settlement. The surrounding neighborhood buzzes with life, attracting both locals and visitors who come to enjoy refreshing drinks while watching breathtaking sunsets over the bay.
name: Porto da Barra Beach
address: Barra, Salvador - State of Bahia, Brazil

excerpt: Barra is a vibrant seaside district home to the bayside Porto da Barra beach, with its calm waters and 17th-century fort, and ocean-facing Farol da Barra which has surf-friendly swells. Dating to 1698 and famed for its sunset views, black-and-white-striped Barra Lighthouse also houses a museum displaying nautical artifacts. There’s a lively bar and dining scene in and around Shopping Barra, a fashionable mall.
detail_description: Barra is a lively seaside district in Salvador, Brazil, known for its beautiful beaches and historical landmarks. The Porto da Barra beach offers calm waters and is overlooked by a 17th-century fort, while the Farol da Barra faces the ocean and attracts surfers with its waves. The iconic Barra Lighthouse, dating back to 1698, not only provides stunning sunset views but also houses a museum showcasing maritime artifacts.
name: Barra
address: Salvador - State of Bahia, Brazil

excerpt: Historical Catholic church with Baroque reliefs & a renovated interior with Neoclassical altars.
detail_description: Igreja da Ordem Terceira Secular de São Francisco is a historical Catholic church known for its Baroque reliefs and renovated Neoclassical altars. Located in Pelourinho, it stands out amidst boutiques, artisan shops, cultural institutions, restaurants, and coffee shops. The original Carmelite church was built in the late 16th century but was later rebuilt after a fire.
name: Igreja da Ordem Terceira Secular de São Francisco
address: R. 12 de Outubro - Pelourinho, Salvador - BA, 40020-360, Brazil

excerpt: Rebuilt after a 1912 bombing, this neoclassical palace & government building has a museum & tours.
detail_description: The Rio Branco Palace, located in the Praca Municipal (Praca Tome de Souza) in Salvador, Brazil, is a neoclassical palace with a rich history dating back to 1549. Originally serving as the seat of the Bahian government and home to the country's first governor general, it underwent reconstruction after fire and bomb damage in the early 20th century. The palace now houses a museum and offers tours for visitors to explore its historic significance.
name: Rio Branco Palace
address: Praça Tomé de Souza, S/N - Centro, Salvador - BA, 40020-000, Brazil

detail_description: Ponta do Humaitá is quickly becoming a must-visit destination in Salvador, renowned for its stunning sunset views and welcoming vibe. Nestled on the Itapagipe peninsula, this picturesque spot offers breathtaking panoramas of the Baia de Todos os Santos. Visitors can explore charming 19th-century architecture, including a historic church adorned with beautiful tiles from the 17th century, alongside a quaint convent and an old lighthouse that adds to its charm.
name: Ponta do Humaitá
address: R. da Boa Viagem, 56 - Monte Serrat, Salvador - BA, 40301-155, Brazil

excerpt: Picturesque natural spring & reservoir featuring 8 large statues of African orishas.
detail_description: Dique do Tororó is a stunning urban oasis located in Salvador, showcasing a picturesque reservoir adorned with eight impressive statues of African orishas. This vibrant park offers an array of recreational activities, including jogging trails, bike paths, and exercise equipment. Families can enjoy two playgrounds and various dining options at the four restaurants that serve international cuisine as well as local specialties. The area also features an outdoor amphitheater with seating for 600 people, making it a hub for cultural events.
name: Dique do Tororó
address: Tororó, Salvador - State of Bahia, 40301-110, Brazil

detail_description: Largo do Pelourinho, also known as Baixa dos Sapateiros, is a charming triangular square with a rich historical significance. It was once the location of the pelourinho, or whipping post. The area is surrounded by other notable landmarks and offers a picturesque setting for visitors to explore and enjoy.
name: Largo do Pelourinho - Centro Histórico
address: Salvador - BA, 40026-280, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant city of Salvador, the Farol da Barra stands as a beacon of history and beauty. This iconic lighthouse not only guides ships safely into the harbor but also offers breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean. Surrounding it are charming beaches and cultural landmarks like Morro do Cristo and Casa de Iemanja, making this area a perfect blend of natural splendor and rich heritage.
name: Farol da barra
address: Brotas, Salvador - BA, 40045-050, Brazil

excerpt: Scenic views draw visitors to this lighthouse originally built at Santo António Fort in the 1690s.
detail_description: The Museu Náutico da Bahia, located at the Farol da Barra lighthouse in Salvador, Brazil, is a hidden gem that offers more than just scenic views. Housed within the lighthouse, this museum showcases a valuable collection of underwater archaeological finds, navigation instruments, nautical signaling artifacts, models and miniatures of various vessels. The permanent exhibition delves into the geography, history, anthropology and culture of the All Saints Bay.
name: Museu Náutico da Bahia - Farol da Barra
address: Largo do Farol da Barra, S/N - Barra, Salvador - BA, 40140-650, Brazil

excerpt: Stately 18th-century church located on a hill & known for its Hall of Miracles & body part replicas.
detail_description: The Basílica do Senhor do Bonfim, an impressive 18th-century church situated on Sacred Hill, is a significant stop on Bahia's religious tourism route. Each year, the renowned Lavagem do Bonfim ceremony unites Catholics and Candomblé practitioners in devotion. The neoclassical interior showcases remarkable works of art such as Francisco Velasco's ceiling panel and Jose Rufino Capinam's paintings at the entrance.
name: Basílica do Senhor do Bonfim
address: Largo do Bonfim, s/n - Bonfim, Salvador - BA, 40415-475, Brazil

detail_description: Salvador is a top destination that offers a mix of world-class beaches, stunning colonial architecture, and vibrant dance rhythms. It has garnered praise from publications like The Guardian and The New York Times for its unique appeal. Whether you're drawn to its rich history or lively culture, Salvador promises an unforgettable experience. Get inspired with a comprehensive 16-page PDF guide that highlights 40 compelling reasons to visit this captivating city.
name: Salvador
address: State of Bahia, Brazil

excerpt: Grassy, oceanside knoll featuring a prominent statue of Jesus Christ, along with sweeping views.
detail_description: Morro do Cristo, located in the Barra neighborhood of Salvador, is a grassy knoll by the ocean featuring a prominent statue of Jesus Christ. The area offers sweeping views of Baia de Todos os Santos and the Farol da Barra lighthouse. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk along Farol da Barra beach to the lighthouse and explore the Bahia Nautica Museum inside.
name: Morro do Cristo
address: Av. Oceânica - Barra, Salvador - BA, Brazil

excerpt: Cobblestone thoroughfare wrapping around a public park with a church, museums & a monument.
detail_description: Praça da Sé - Comercio is a historic square in Salvador, Bahia that has been the center of controversy throughout its history. It used to be home to the old temple of Se Primacial of Brazil, which was demolished in 1933. Today, it features a large sidewalk and historical monuments such as the Memorial to the Baianas do Acaraje and the Zumbi dos Palmares.
name: Praça da Sé - Centro Histórico
address: Salvador - BA, 40301-110, Brazil

detail_description: Casa do Carnaval da Bahia is a vibrant museum that offers an interactive and engaging journey through the history of the renowned Carnival of Salvador. Housed in a historic building near the Cathedral Basilica of Sao Salvador, this museum spans four floors and showcases an extensive collection of carnival-related artifacts, including models, costumes, instruments, photos, and historical documents. Visitors can immerse themselves in the rhythms of the carnival through video projections and two cinemas with informative displays.
name: Casa do Carnaval da Bahia
address: Praça Ramos de Queirós, s/n - Pelourinho, Salvador - BA, 40026-055, Brazil

detail_description: During my week-long adventure in Salvador, one of the standout experiences was visiting the Feira de São Joaquim. This vibrant market is a treasure trove of sights and sounds, showcasing an eclectic mix of fresh fruits, meats, and unique items like medicinal herbs and infused cachaças. The atmosphere is lively yet rustic, with half-renovated structures adding to its charm.
name: Feira de São Joaquim
address: Av. Eng. Oscar Pontes - Comércio, Salvador - BA, 40411-220, Brazil

detail_description: Ondina Beach is a popular spot on Salvador's Carnaval circuit and is home to the Gordinhas de Ondina monument. Situated in one of the city's upscale neighborhoods, it boasts excellent infrastructure. The beach itself is mostly rocky with a narrow stretch of sand, offering a unique coastal experience.
name: Ondina
address: Salvador - State of Bahia, Brazil

detail_description: Praça Terreiro de Jesus is a vibrant square located next to Praca da Se, featuring the cathedral that was once the church of the former Jesuit College. Constructed between 1604 and 1656, its facade is adorned with stone brought from Portugal as ballast, while its interior boasts Baroque-style decorations from the 18th century. The square is a lively hub where vendors, tourists, capoeira performers, and locals converge in a colorful spectacle.
name: Praça Terreiro de Jesus
address: Centro Histórico, Salvador - BA, 40026-010, Brazil

excerpt: Former home of writers Jorge Amado & Zélia Gattai featuring exhibits related to their lives & work.
detail_description: Nestled in the lively neighborhood of Rio Vermelho, Casa do Rio Vermelho stands as a tribute to the literary genius of Jorge Amado and his wife Zélia Gattai. This former home, now transformed into a captivating museum, offers an intimate look at their lives over four decades. Visitors can wander through personal spaces like their traditional Bahian kitchen and extensive library, surrounded by an impressive collection of art that reflects their deep ties to Bahian culture.
name: a Casa do Rio Vermelho
address: R. Alagoinhas, 33 - Rio Vermelho, Salvador - BA, 41940-620, Brazil

detail_description: Teatro Castro Alves is a renowned performing arts venue in Salvador, home to the Bahian Symphony Orchestra and the Bale de Castro Alves. Despite facing a major fire before its inauguration in 1958, it finally opened to the public in 1967. The theater boasts excellent audio-visual technology and features original artwork based on Castro Alves's famous poem about the horrors of the slave trade.
name: Teatro Castro Alves
address: Praça Dois de Julho, s/n - Campo Grande, Salvador - BA, 40080-121, Brazil

excerpt: Circular, stone sea fort & former prison dating from the 17th century, built on a reef.
detail_description: São Marcelo Fort is a circular fortress constructed on a reef during the 17th century, serving as both a sea fort and former prison. Its unique doughnut shape has earned it the nickname "belly button of the world" by Brazilian author Jorge Amado. Located near Terminal Maritimo in Bahia, this historical site showcases stunning architecture and serves as a reminder of Brazil's rich cultural past.
name: São Marcelo Fort
address: Salvador - BA, 40301-110, Brazil

excerpt: Genteel palace-turned-museum featuring historical paintings & sculptures, plus cultural events.
detail_description: The Bahia Museum of Art is housed in a refined palace and showcases historical paintings, sculptures, and hosts cultural events. Salvador is renowned for its stunning beaches, particularly those to the north which are popular among tourists and locals. The city also boasts the giant Carnival, one of the world's largest. Visitors recommend visiting the museum in the early evening to catch the sunset and enjoying local cuisine nearby. The staff is praised for their hospitality and knowledge.
name: Bahia Museum of Art
address: Av. Sete de Setembro, 2340 - Corredor da Vitória, Salvador - BA, 40080-004, Brazil

excerpt: Preserved onetime home of photographer, researcher & ethnographer Pierre Verger, with guided tours.
detail_description: The Foundation Pierre Verger, located in the former home of the renowned photographer and ethnographer Pierre Verger, offers guided tours for visitors. Verger, who made Salvador his home, dedicated much of his life to studying African culture and the Candomble religion. The foundation showcases exhibits that highlight the shared heritage of these regions and features a rich collection of Verger's exquisite photographs.
name: Foundation Pierre Verger
address: R. Vila América, 6 - 2ª - Engenho Velho de Brotas, Salvador - BA, 40243-340, Brazil

detail_description: Flamengo Beach in Salvador is a picturesque stretch of coastline, known for its natural beauty and diverse offerings. The beach features a wild, unspoiled landscape with dunes and coconut trees, making it one of the most stunning beaches in the area. It caters to various preferences, offering both tranquil stretches for relaxation and lively areas with bustling activity such as surfers riding the waves and vibrant beachside kiosks.
name: Flamengo Beach
address: State of Bahia, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled between the bustling Mercado Modelo and the iconic Elevador Lacerda, Cidade da Música da Bahia is a captivating museum dedicated to celebrating the vibrant history of Bahian music. This immersive experience invites visitors to explore an array of audiovisual exhibits that highlight the city's diverse musical styles and cultural movements from its inception to modern times.
name: Cidade da Música da Bahia
address: Pr. Visc. de Cayru, 19 - Comércio, Salvador - BA, 40015-170, Brazil

detail_description: If you haven't experienced the thrill of following a trio on one of Salvador's famous circuits during Carnival, you're missing out. The anticipation of seeing top performers like Olodum, Saulo Fernandes, and Bell Marques is enough to make anyone excited for the end of the pandemic. If you're considering attending Carnival 2024 in Salvador, rest assured that ticket purchases can be made with complete comfort and security directly in Salvador without having to rely on online transactions.
name: Quero Abadá | Blocos e Camarotes para Carnaval de Salvador
address: Shopping Paralela, Av. Luís Viana Filho, 8544 - piso G1 - Alphaville, Salvador - BA, 41730-101, Brazil

excerpt: Historic red-&-white-striped lighthouse on the beach, popular with photographers & sunset viewers.
detail_description: Farol de Itapuã, located on Praia de Itapua in Salvador, Brazil, is a historic red-and-white-striped lighthouse that attracts photographers and sunset enthusiasts. This 21-meter tower is one of the many working lighthouses in Salvador and offers breathtaking views of the rocky coastline. Visitors can explore its rich history with ship models and salvaged artifacts dating back to the 17th century.
name: Farol de Itapuã
address: R. Farol de Itapuã, s/n - Itapuã, Salvador - BA, 41630-240, Brazil

excerpt: 18th-century Catholic church with neoclassical altars built by a brotherhood of enslaved Africans.
detail_description: This neoclassical-style church is an impressive sight with finely detailed windows and doors, as well as a neoclassical altar. It also has statues of Lady of the Rosary and other saints from the 18th century.
name: Church of Our Lady of the Rosary of the Black People
address: Largo do Pelourinho, s/n - Pelourinho, Salvador - BA, 40026-280, Brazil

excerpt: Mansion-turned-museum exhibiting a historic collection of jewelry, silver & furniture, plus art.
detail_description: The Carlos Costa Pinto Museum, located in a grand mansion in Salvador, Bahia, Brazil, offers a historic collection of jewelry, silverware, furniture and art. The museum showcases the influence of African culture on Brazilian heritage through carved figures, musical instruments and religious objects from the Candomble tradition. Visitors can admire unique pieces crafted by local artisans using precious metals like silver and gold, as well as crystal and porcelain. The museum also features a charming cafe with outdoor seating for a relaxing break.
name: Carlos Costa Pinto Museum
address: Av. Sete de Setembro, 2490 - Vitória, Salvador - BA, 40080-005, Brazil

excerpt: Built for the Confederations Cup in 2013, this stadium now hosts home matches of Bahia & concerts.
detail_description: Itaipava Fonte Nova Arena, originally built for the Confederations Cup in 2013, is now the home ground for Bahia and a venue for concerts. The stadium, with a capacity of 50,000 people, was completely rebuilt by German architects and hosted key matches in the 2014 FIFA World Cup. It offers guided tours that provide insights into its history and architecture.
name: Fonte Nova Arena
address: Ladeira da Fonte das Pedras, s/n - Nazaré, Salvador - BA, 40050-565, Brazil

excerpt: Art museum combining a 1912 mansion, a modern wing, a garden with works by Rodin & an open-air cafe.
detail_description: The Palace of Arts, also known as Palacete das Artes Rodin Bahia, is a captivating art museum in Salvador that seamlessly blends a 1912 mansion with a modern wing and an enchanting garden adorned with works by Rodin. The historic mansion hosts temporary exhibitions featuring modern and contemporary artists, along with a remarkable display of 62 plaster pieces by Auguste Rodin. Additionally, the space offers courses, workshops, and events tailored for scholars and art enthusiasts.
name: Palace of Arts
address: R. da Graça, 284 - Graça, Salvador - BA, 40150-060, Brazil

excerpt: This 16th-century hexagon-shaped fortress with an Italian-inspired design overlooks Salvador's port.
detail_description: Forte de Nossa Senhora de Monte Serrat is a 16th-century hexagon-shaped fortress with an Italian-inspired design that offers stunning views of Salvador's port. It features a large lawn and overlooks the picturesque Monte Serrat Beach, where visitors can witness breathtaking sunsets against the backdrop of the Bay of All Saints. The site also includes the Church and Monastery of Lady of Mount Cerra, a notable collection of colonial architecture from the 17th century.
name: Forte de Nossa Senhora de Monte Serrat
address: Boa Viagem, Salvador - BA, 40301-155, Brazil

detail_description: The Sister Dulce Social Work Association is a remarkable institution that embodies the spirit of compassion and service. Visitors are encouraged to explore the museum dedicated to Sister Dulce, which beautifully narrates her inspiring journey of love and commitment to helping others. The association operates the Sister Dulce Hospital, offering completely free medical care supported by cutting-edge technology and skilled professionals.
name: Sister Dulce Social Work Association
address: Av. Dendezeiros do Bonfim, 2 - Roma, Salvador - BA, 40415-006, Brazil

excerpt: Popular, family-friendly sandy beach featuring coconut groves, surfing & bodyboarding.
detail_description: Stella Maris Beach is a vibrant and family-friendly destination nestled in Salvador, renowned for its stunning sandy shores and lush coconut groves. This beach is a haven for surfers, boasting strong waves that thrill those seeking adventure. At low tide, the landscape transforms as natural tidal pools emerge, providing a safe play area for children to splash around while parents relax nearby. The warm green waters invite visitors to indulge in activities like jet skiing and bodyboarding.
name: Stella Maris beach
address: State of Bahia, 41600-090, Brazil

excerpt: Built in the early 17th century, this restored fort offers cultural events & scenic bay views.
detail_description: Nestled just before the iconic Barra Lighthouse, the Carybé Arts Space at São Diogo Fort is a captivating destination that beautifully marries history and culture. This 17th-century fortress has been thoughtfully restored to house an interactive digital art gallery showcasing the works of Carybé, who draws inspiration from Bahian culture and Candomblé's rich iconography. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking views of the bay while exploring historical artifacts like ancient cannons.
name: Espaço Carybé de Artes - Forte de São Diogo
address: R. do Forte de São Diogo, s/n - Porto da Barra, Salvador - BA, 40130-170, Brazil

excerpt: Museum highlighting the women of Bahia, with colorful dresses & traditional crafts on display.
name: Memorial das Baianas
address: Cruz Caída, Praça da Sé - Pelourinho, Salvador - BA, 40301-155, Brazil

name: Flamengo Beach
address: State of Bahia, Brazil

excerpt: Scenic views draw visitors to this lighthouse originally built at Santo António Fort in the 1690s.
detail_description: Museu Náutico da Bahia - Farol da Barra is a captivating destination that offers a blend of history and breathtaking views. The lighthouse, originally constructed in the 1690s, now houses an exceptional nautical museum featuring relics from the era of Portuguese exploration and exhibits on the slave trade. Visitors can enjoy stunning panoramic views while exploring the museum's collection, which includes model ships and ships in bottles.
name: Museu Náutico da Bahia - Farol da Barra
address: Largo do Farol da Barra, S/N - Barra, Salvador - BA, 40140-650, Brazil

detail_description: The Irmã Dulce Memorial is a museum dedicated to the life and missionary work of Irma Dulce, an Afro-Brasilian nun who was canonized by the Vatican in 2015. The museum features real items from her personal life, as well as a life-size statue of Irma Dulce that can be taken selfies with. There is also a Blessed water station where visitors can take home bottles of water filled with Irma Dulce's relics.
name: Memorial Irmã Dulce
address: Av. Dendezeiros do Bonfim, 161 - Bonfim, Salvador - BA, 40415-180, Brazil
